sect2.title: Preview
sect2.para: There are two packages for windows :

listitem.para: The first contains all required dependencies (Python 2.7 and PyQt). It can be downloaded from here.
The second one, which can also be downloaded from here, does not contain Python and PyQt, so you will need to install the three following dependencies before launching DFF installation :
Microsoft Visual C++ 2010 Redistributable Package (x86) only if you are a Windows XP user.

note.para: The form on DFF download page is OPTIONAL . If you do not wish to send any information, just leave it empty and directly click on the Download button.

sect2.title: Install DFF
sect2.para: Once you have download one of the installer, you can run it by double-clicking on it. The following window will be opened :

caption.para: Click on the Next button (or Cancel if you wish to cancel the installation).

sect2.para: On the next screen, you will be asked to accept the license terms.

caption.para: If you disagree, click on Cancel to quit the installation, otherwise click on I agree.

sect2.para: Then select in which directory you want to install DFF (by default in C:\Program files\DFF).

caption.para: Click on the Browse... button if you wish to change the installation directory (optional). Once you are done, click on the Next button.

sect2.para: You will be asked for the name of the shortcut you want to create in your Start -> programs menu (by default, Digital Forensics Framework).

caption.para: You can rename it or chose an existing directory in the list. You can also check the Do not create shortcuts check-box to avoid creating shortcuts on your desktop.

sect2.para: If you have chosen the installer with Python dependencies, read the following part Install Python and PyQT. Otherwise you can directly switch to finish install part.

sect2.title: Install Python and PyQt
sect2.para: You will be asked if you want to install Python
Python 2.7 AND PyQt 4.8 (or superior) are required to run DFF, so click Yes if do not have already installed those dependencies. Otherwise you can click No and directly go to finish install part.

caption.para: Click Yes on the pop-up, and then Next of the wizard.

sect2.para: One mire time, you will be asked to accept the license terms of PyQt.

caption.para: Click on I Agree if you agree with those terms. Otherwise, click Cancel to quit the installation.

sect2.para: Select which PyQt components you wish to install.

note.para: Even though every components are selected on the screen-shot, the only ones which are required are Extensions modules (checked by default) and Qt runtime. Among the others, select the ones you are interested in.

sect2.para: You will have to select in which directory you want to install Python (C:\Python27 by default).

caption.para: If you wish to change this directory, click on the Browse... button and select the new location. Once you are done you can click on Install.

sect2.para: Once this intallation is finished, you can click on Finish.
And do the same with the following installation :
Then you can chose to install microsoft DLL dependencies (required to run DFF).

caption.para: Click on Yes if you want to install them. Wait during the installation.

sect2.title: Finish Install
sect2.para: Once the installation is finished, you can click on the Finish button.
You can now start using DFF. If you did not check the Do not create shortcuts check-box when setting up DFF installation, two short-cuts should be created on your Desktop.

listitem.para: The one called DFF (shell) will launch DFF command line interface.
The second one, called DFF (gui) is used to launch DFF graphical user interface.
